etymologies: modern Latin, feminine of Latin cinerarius ‘of ashes’, from cinis, ciner- ‘ashes’ (because of the ash-colored down on the leaves)

definitions: a plant of the daisy family with compact masses of bright flowers, often cultivated as a houseplant.

notes.text: Genus Pericallis (formerly Senecio or Cineraria), family Compositae

shortDefinitions: plant of daisy family with compact masses of bright flowers, cultivated as winter-flowering pot plant
